plan: I will test the following bidding strategies: 1) Bid on A at 75% of my value for A ($47) and B at 75% of my value for B ($58). 2) Place an aggressive bid on AB at its value ($140) to test the waters. 3) Another round, bid on A at 90% of my value for A ($57) and on B at 90% of my value for B ($69), then switch up for data-gathering. Learn from bid outcomes and adjust future bids. This approach will balance caution and aggression to gather data and maximize profit over time.

I will test aggressive bids on AB to capitalize on the high combined value. In the first round, I will bid 120 on AB to aim for maximum profit. Next, I'll place more conservative bids on individual goods, like 40 on A and 15 on B, to analyze competitor behavior and prices. Additionally, I will alternate between high-risk and low-risk bids in subsequent rounds, closely reviewing previous results to identify patterns and adjust my strategy for long-term profit maximization.

In the next few rounds, I will test a mix of conservative and aggressive strategies. Initially, I will bid slightly above my value for A (e.g., $24) and a minimal bid for B (e.g., $1) to gauge opponents' patterns. Then, I will place an aggressive bid close to my value combined (AB) like $45 to potentially secure both goods. I will alternate these strategies to gather data on my opponents' reactions and adapt accordingly to maximize profit.
